title: Soil and Water Chemistry
description: Chemical processes governing weathering, soil mineral formation and stability, common solubility equilibria. Use of chemical principles to explain surface chemical properties of soils and environmental problems in water and soil chemical systems. Preparation of professional quality reports based on laboratory data and library research. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory, 1 activity.
prerequisites: ERSC 223, CHEM 129, CHEM 212/312 or CHEM 216/316, MATH 118 or MATH 141
